title: Wendy Rubi Chavez Tacuri
text:
Welcome! I’m currently studying International Affairs at John Cabot University in Rome, with a minor in Economics. I’m especially interested in economic development, international relations, and sustainability. Latin America has a special meaning to me, shaped by my Peruvian and Ecuadorian background.
Before university, I attended the Giuseppe Garibaldi Agricultural Technical Institute, where I developed an early interest in sustainable development and global issues.
This website is a space where I share some of the academic projects and researches I’ve worked on during my studies. Feel free to explore and learn more about my work!
You can also check out my CV.

title: Portfolio
text:
This is my most recent project, completed for the course Computational Methods: Text Analysis in Python. The goal was to explore how Latin America is represented in UN General Debate speeches using real-world text data, sentiment analysis, and topic modeling techniques.





Project


Goal


Materials






Latin America in UN General Debates


Analyze how Latin America is framed in UN speeches using Python-based text analysis


Presentation | Report
